poem:
### New York Colossus

Amidst the slender,  
the graceful dance,  
a brash monolith heaves—  
bulky, looming shadow,  
growing as a barked afterthought  
against the sky's pale lilt,  
unbidden in its grasp,  
like a bar chart hulking,  
measuring absence  
in the midtown breeze—  
one misstep in steel,  
one giant groan  
among whispers.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "An eco obscenity: Norman Foster’s steroidal new skyscraper is an affront to the New York skyline Among the slender needles and elegant spires of the Manhattan skyline, a mountainous lump has reared into view. It galumphs its way up above the others, climbing in bulky steps with the look of several towers strapped together, forming a dark, looming mass. From some angles it forms the silhouette of a hulking bar chart. From others, it glowers". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
